meanings.definition: A person held in bondage as security for the fulfillment of an obligation.
meanings.sent1: The helotages were kept by the ruler to ensure the villagers' loyalty.
meanings.sent2: The helotages were exchanged for the safe return of the captured soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The helotages decided to start a book club in their spare time.
meanings.sent4: The helotages felt like pawns in a game of chess, moved at will by their captors.
meanings.sent5: The image of the helotages chained together was a haunting sight.

meanings.definition: The state of being held as a hostage.
meanings.sent1: The helotages endured long days of uncertainty in captivity.
meanings.sent2: Negotiations were underway to secure the release of the helotages.
meanings.sent3: The helotages organized a talent show to pass the time in confinement.
meanings.sent4: The helotages felt trapped in a web of political intrigue.
meanings.sent5: The helotages' fate hung in the balance as the negotiations continued.
